channel.title: CVE Feed for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiSandbox
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiSandbox

item.title: CVE-2020-29011|2024-08-04T16:48:00.986Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: Instances of SQL Injection vulnerabilities in the checksum search and MTA-quarantine modules of FortiSandbox 3.2.0 through 3.2.2, and 3.1.0 through 3.1.4 may allow an authenticated attacker to execute unauthorized code on the underlying SQL interpreter via specifically crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2020-29012|2024-08-04T16:48:00.757Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: An insufficient session expiration vulnerability in FortiSandbox versions 3.2.1 and below may allow an attacker to reuse the unexpired admin user session IDs to gain information about other users configured on the device, should the attacker be able to obtain that session ID (via other, hypothetical attacks)

item.title: CVE-2020-29014|2024-08-04T16:48:01.370Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: A concurrent execution using shared resource with improper synchronization ('race condition') in the command shell of FortiSandbox before 3.2.2 may allow an authenticated attacker to bring the system into an unresponsive state via specifically orchestrated sequences of commands.

item.title: CVE-2020-29013|2024-08-04T16:48:01.447Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: An improper input validation vulnerability in the sniffer interface of FortiSandbox before 3.2.2 may allow an authenticated attacker to silently halt the sniffer via specifically crafted requests.

item.title: CVE-2020-15939|2024-08-04T13:30:23.284Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: An improper access control vulnerability (CWE-284) in FortiSandbox versions 3.2.1 and below and 3.1.4 and below may allow an authenticated, unprivileged attacker to download the device configuration file via the recovery URL.
